name: Thai Chicken Satay Skewers
description: Delicious Thai chicken satay skewers with a spicy peanut sauce. Perfect for a flavorful dinner.
keywords: thai chicken satay, chicken satay skewers, thai skewers, asian chicken, spicy chicken skewers, peanut sauce, satay, thai food, asian cuisine, grilled chicken, appetizer, dinner, party food, chicken thighs, coconut milk, curry, peanut butter

recipeInstructions.name: Skewer Prep
recipeInstructions.text: Soak skewers for 2 hours in water or skip this and use metal skewers.

recipeInstructions.name: Marinate Chicken
recipeInstructions.text: Mix the chicken and marinade ingredients with 1/4 of the can of coconut milk. Let it marinate for 20 minutes to 24 hours.

recipeInstructions.name: Skewer Chicken
recipeInstructions.text: Thread the chicken onto the skewers, about 3-5 pieces per skewer.

recipeInstructions.name: Prep Pan
recipeInstructions.text: Heat oil in a large non-stick pan over high heat or fire up the BBQ.

recipeInstructions.name: Cook Skewers
recipeInstructions.text: Cook the skewers in batches for about 3 minutes on each side until golden. Reduce the heat if the chicken starts to burn before being cooked through.

recipeInstructions.name: Prep Sauce
recipeInstructions.text: For the sauce, place the remaining coconut milk and peanut sauce ingredients in a small pot over medium heat. Mix well and lower the heat once it starts to bubble. Taste for seasoning and adjust if needed. Add a little water if the sauce gets too thick.

recipeInstructions.name: Serve
recipeInstructions.text: Serve the Thai chicken satay skewers with rice, vegetables, lime wedges, coriander leaves, sliced red chilli, and sprinkle chopped peanuts on top. Enjoy!

notes: One of my personal favorite recipes. The skewers are great as part of a larger banquet as well.
Doesn't need to be on skewers, you can just prep the chicken and then fry that in batches. Make sure not to crowd the pan so it still gets nice and golden.
